meanings.definition: To bring into renewed existence; to revive or restore
meanings.sent1: After the storm, the sun regenerates the flowers, making them bloom again.
meanings.sent2: The company regenerates its old buildings, giving them a fresh new look.
meanings.sent3: The magic potion regenerates the worn-out shoes, making them dance on their own!
meanings.sent4: Her kindness regenerates hope in the hearts of those who have lost it.
meanings.sent5: The music regenerates memories of happy times, filling the room with joy.

meanings.definition: To undergo regeneration; to be renewed or restored
meanings.sent1: The lizard regenerates its tail when it is in danger, growing a new one.
meanings.sent2: The forest regenerates after a fire, with new plants growing in place of the old ones.
meanings.sent3: The superhero's powers regenerates every time he eats a special fruit.
meanings.sent4: The city regenerates its spirit after a tragedy, coming back stronger than before.
meanings.sent5: The starfish regenerates its limbs if they are damaged, showing the power of nature.

meanings.definition: To cause to be reborn or renewed
meanings.sent1: The artist regenerates the old canvas, turning it into a masterpiece.
meanings.sent2: The teacher regenerates the students' interest in learning with fun activities.
meanings.sent3: The fairy regenerates the pumpkin into a carriage for the princess.
meanings.sent4: His words regenerates her confidence, making her believe in herself again.
meanings.sent5: The rain regenerates the dry land, bringing life back to the barren fields.
